story:
Short Summary

 JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will be a cafe and candy kiosk located in Waco, TX  which will offer a variety of food inside of Richland Mall. Operations will be run by two locals, Stephanie and Jeanette Satchell. This restaurant will be family-friendly, owned, and operated.   

Both girls have backgrounds in business, retail, and foodservice. Always wanting to own a family fun and friendly establishment, both girls decided to open their own restaurant in Richland Mall, with the hopes of going out in their own building off of Elm Street.

JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will feature great food and will be near convenient shopping. When you get hungry and tired of the same meals that are located in Richland Mall, JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will offer a different menu every week to keep things from going down. Stephanie is a great cook with decades of foodservice background and cooking experience. Jeanette is a baker who knows many different ways to make the perfect dessert.

Along with having lots of experience, we know that finances are a must. No matter how much funds you have, you should always assume you need more. There is no end when there is so much to purchase – licenses, equipment, rentals, signage, repairs, insurance, etc.

We are both deeply passionate about cooking and are always learning new and better ways to make a dish.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise 50K to get the restaurant up and running, and you can be our biggest contributor. The money raised will be spent on buying deep fryers, chairs, tables, and other things that are needed to open the restaurant.

In a city full of amazing cafes and eateries, JS Sweet Spot and Eatery hopes to bring something different: Once we are able to obtain a building of our own we will be transforming space that, by day, provides everything a great neighborhood cafe can. And by night, a private enclave for friends to gather and create, work, exhibit, or simply relax. Waco has got the talent; let us provide the space, the caffeine, and the tools to utilize and explore those talents.

To be clear: We would never ask for hand-outs - we want you to get exactly what you pay for (and then a whole lot more!).  Our team put together different packages for you to select from.  Whether you're planning a meal for 2 people or a party for 75, we're here to help!   We simply ask that you take a moment to browse the options and consider supporting JS Eatery by pre-purchasing breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, or party.  Make it an epic shindig, a romantic gesture, a surprise party, a birthday celebration, an event just because, or a one-of-a-kind gift....you can't go wrong here folks! And even just a simple donation will do.

The Impact

By helping us, you are not only helping support a black-owned business, but you will also support the jobs that it provides. You are helping to bring joy to family everywhere to have the opportunity to enjoy meals more than in the past.

Later, we plan to open a different location and have different acts come up and perform, whether it is comedy night, soul night, family fun night, etc., we will build to last. 

JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will be a community-focused café. We will buy all our meat and ingredients from local producers and we also employ our local youth as young as 14. This will allow them to enter the workforce and learn the way to make a dollar.

We will also support local community projects, promote local businesses, and contribute tremendously to our local youth. But we need your help. 

We created this campaign as a way for you to plan for those good times ahead by pre-purchasing an activity at JS Sweet Spot and Eatery (at a discount!).  This, in turn, helps us to support our staff during this down-time and make the process of opening much quicker.  

Risks & Challenges

The main risk and challenges that will arise is another pandemic. A time where unemployment and quarantine is a must. People will always need food and time out of the house, when they visit the mall (while we are there) then they will see a great place to eat. When the time comes (when we open at a different location), people will be able to come out and enjoy a night out alone, in a group, in family settings, or even just a date. There will always be risks and challenges, however, we are willing to fight through them and overcome the obstacles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your financial support. If you can’t do it, that is ok, but we ask that you please help us spread the word by sharing this fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages to help us reach our goal. Any amount can help.

Just think: when all of this over and you can make up for lost time with 

friends and family, it's going to be epic!

Thank you for taking the time to consider JS Sweet Spot and Eatery!  

Feel free to share our campaign and help us all focus on future fun! 

Meet The Owners
story_txt:
Short Summary
 JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will be a cafe and candy kiosk located in Waco, TX  which will offer a variety of food inside of Richland Mall. Operations will be run by two locals, Stephanie and Jeanette Satchell. This restaurant will be family-friendly, owned, and operated.   
Both girls have backgrounds in business, retail, and foodservice. Always wanting to own a family fun and friendly establishment, both girls decided to open their own restaurant in Richland Mall, with the hopes of going out in their own building off of Elm Street.
JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will feature great food and will be near convenient shopping. When you get hungry and tired of the same meals that are located in Richland Mall, JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will offer a different menu every week to keep things from going down. Stephanie is a great cook with decades of foodservice background and cooking experience. Jeanette is a baker who knows many different ways to make the perfect dessert.
Along with having lots of experience, we know that finances are a must. No matter how much funds you have, you should always assume you need more. There is no end when there is so much to purchase – licenses, equipment, rentals, signage, repairs, insurance, etc.
We are both deeply passionate about cooking and are always learning new and better ways to make a dish.  
What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise 50K to get the restaurant up and running, and you can be our biggest contributor. The money raised will be spent on buying deep fryers, chairs, tables, and other things that are needed to open the restaurant.
In a city full of amazing cafes and eateries, JS Sweet Spot and Eatery hopes to bring something different: Once we are able to obtain a building of our own we will be transforming space that, by day, provides everything a great neighborhood cafe can. And by night, a private enclave for friends to gather and create, work, exhibit, or simply relax. Waco has got the talent; let us provide the space, the caffeine, and the tools to utilize and explore those talents.
To be clear: We would never ask for hand-outs - we want you to get exactly what you pay for (and then a whole lot more!).  Our team put together different packages for you to select from.  Whether you're planning a meal for 2 people or a party for 75, we're here to help!   We simply ask that you take a moment to browse the options and consider supporting JS Eatery by pre-purchasing breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, or party.  Make it an epic shindig, a romantic gesture, a surprise party, a birthday celebration, an event just because, or a one-of-a-kind gift....you can't go wrong here folks! And even just a simple donation will do.

The Impact
By helping us, you are not only helping support a black-owned business, but you will also support the jobs that it provides. You are helping to bring joy to family everywhere to have the opportunity to enjoy meals more than in the past.
Later, we plan to open a different location and have different acts come up and perform, whether it is comedy night, soul night, family fun night, etc., we will build to last. 
JS Sweet Spot and Eatery will be a community-focused café. We will buy all our meat and ingredients from local producers and we also employ our local youth as young as 14. This will allow them to enter the workforce and learn the way to make a dollar.
We will also support local community projects, promote local businesses, and contribute tremendously to our local youth. But we need your help. 
We created this campaign as a way for you to plan for those good times ahead by pre-purchasing an activity at JS Sweet Spot and Eatery (at a discount!).  This, in turn, helps us to support our staff during this down-time and make the process of opening much quicker.  

Risks & Challenges
The main risk and challenges that will arise is another pandemic. A time where unemployment and quarantine is a must. People will always need food and time out of the house, when they visit the mall (while we are there) then they will see a great place to eat. When the time comes (when we open at a different location), people will be able to come out and enjoy a night out alone, in a group, in family settings, or even just a date. There will always be risks and challenges, however, we are willing to fight through them and overcome the obstacles. 

Other Ways You Can Help
We need your financial support. If you can’t do it, that is ok, but we ask that you please help us spread the word by sharing this fundraiser on your Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages to help us reach our goal. Any amount can help.
Just think: when all of this over and you can make up for lost time with 
friends and family, it's going to be epic!
Thank you for taking the time to consider JS Sweet Spot and Eatery!  
Feel free to share our campaign and help us all focus on future fun! 
Meet The Owners

story:
3-in-1 Spoon Shaped Metal Filter Straw

No More French Press

       

 

This innovative metal straw is designed into a spoon shape, and filters out unwanted particles in liquid drinks.  It can be used for coffee, tea, Yerba Mate, or juices; really, any drink that needs filtering.  This straw will help eliminate all of the mess and hassle that goes into making your favorite drink.

Do you prefer the taste of coffee brewed in a French press over drip coffee, but avoid it because of clean up?  Just add your favorite coffee and hot water into a mug, let sit, and then enjoy through our metal filter straw.  No bulky item with multiple pieces to clean when you are finished.

Do you prefer using loose-leaf tea so you can blend your own flavors, but hate having to strain the leaves after?  Just add your favorite tea blend and hot water into a cup, let sit, and then enjoy through our metal filter straw.  You will save money on tea bags and be able to have just the right flavor of tea at any time.

 

 

Do you prefer fresh squeezed juice but hate the pulp?  Squeeze the juice straight into a glass and use our metal filter straw. You will get to enjoy your freshly squeezed juice leaving all the pulp behind.  Our straw is also great when adding fresh juice to make your favorite cocktail.

Do you care about the environment, but just have to use a straw for certain drinks?  Use our metal filter straw and stop harming the environment by throwing away countless plastic straws.

 

Our metal filter straw is made of food grade stainless steel.  It is durable and dishwasher safe. The filter metal straw is 6 1/4 inches (15,9 cm) long and 1 inch (2,5 cm) wide, weighs only 1/2 ounce (13 grams). The holes at the spoon base are 1 mm diameter.  This straw is so light and durable,you take it with you everywhere.

 

FAQ:

Q: What kind of metal is your straw made from?

A: Stainless steel (304 – 18/10)

 

Q:Is your metal filter straw dishwasher safe?

A: Yes they are, you can safely place them in your dishwasher.

 

Q: How do you wash the straw?

A: You can use a mild soap and warm water, or you can place it in the dishwasher.

 

Q: How much does it cost to ship to my home?

A: If you order now, we will provide free shipping anywhere world wide.

 

Q: When are they going to be ready?

A: As soon as the campaign finishes, we will manufacture them and ship them to our backers. Approximately, in the end of September 2018 you can have them delivered to your door.

 

Risks and Challenges:

Since we already manufactured some, there is practically none. After the campaign we will just manufacture more and send all of our backers’ products. This is an early bird campaign and shipping is free to worldwide.

story:
Meet Cool Zipper Bag

A reusable bag containing cooling gel!!!

Bags are stackable and take up barely any space

It's perfect for school lunches, and ideal for summer picnics, cooling both food and drinks

 

The Cool Idea

 

Years ago, when I was in elementary school, my mother used to put a cheese sandwich in my backpack, but the cheese became dry by lunchtime, a couple of hours later.

I was very motivated to develop a cooling method for keeping the food fresh outdoors. The whole family participated in the development until we came with this great idea!

It is a fun and healthy product, and we use it on many occasions. My kids use the bag for school lunch, enjoying fresh meals every day. It turned out that they eat much more fruits at school since.  Isn't it Cool?

The Cool bag is a healthy solution for the whole family - when you're at work or university, doing sports, camping and even while going to the beach.

 

Cool Features

  • Gel is made of 79% water,20% Glycerin and 1% Sodium CMC
  • Completely non-toxic and safe
  • Nylon is made of double sided PEPA. Thickness is 0.085cm
  • Items weight and size:
    • Small Zipper Bag
      •  16.7cm X 18.7cm.
      • 0.120 kg
    • Large Zipper Bag
      •  24.8cm X 26.9cm
      •  0.240 kg
    • Small Beverage Cooler (suitable for cans and small bottles)
      •  12.3cm X 10.5cm
      •  0.075 kg
    • Large Beverage Cooler (suitable for large bottles and wine)
      •  26.5cm X 10.5cm
      •  0.150 kg

Cool Design

  • Small Cool bag

  • Large Cool bag

Questions & Answers

Support Us

In order to start mass production of Cool, we need your support. It would be really cool to see our product become a reality and allow many people enjoy fresh and healthy food

It turns out making different shapes such as hearts, stars and dolphins is quite expensive, so those who support us will receive a survey to vote which patterns we will produce. And to anyone who will support the product will have the first right to receive it in a significant discount​

We can't do it without your help.

Please share our Cool products with your friends. The larger our community, we can start mass production with new exciting designs soon!

Back us & Share for a chance to win a refund of  "10 items - ultimate pack" - We will announce the winner at end of the campaign

Contact Us

For any questions, do not hesitate to reach out 

coolzipperbags@gmail.com

story:
Who we are? 

A team of young enthusiastic people sharing a strong background in the fields of Agriculture, Advance Technology with more than 40 years combined experience in business
development and management in the Middle East. We have been serving the ever growing and ever demanding young population of MENA and GCC regions, setting trends and standards with a range of Smart Food Solutions, thus adding real value to F&B Operators, Households and Businesses in general.

Our mission?

We are committed to using all our knowledge and experience about sustainable plant
growing techniques in order to develop a 360° system which will ensure an easy, accessible
and healthy urban farming system, the ultimate farm-to-table solution.

Our solution?

BUSTAN. 

A hybrid indoor cultivator, with mobile remote control for growing microgreens.

The system will allow users to grow their own greens by selecting the strain of micro greens, micro herbs, salad mix and lettuce of their choice and will take care of their plant from seeding to harvesting.

BUSTAN is easy to operate with a complete set of guidelines that simplify the process of growing. It is designed for both experts and beginners. The user is able to manage complex processes thanks to a very user friendly remote mobile app.

With advance technology and ambient control on growing conditions , one can grow all kinds of varieties 365 days a year.

But first we need YOUR help...

The main principles behind BUSTAN are the following:
-Artificial Intelligence
-Hybrid Technology
-Ebb & Flow System
-Aeroponics System
-Data Monitoring
-24/7 Mobile Access

Our funding goals?

To help develop our functional prototype we are looking to raise 18,000$.

What does making the prototype involve?

1. Engineering and designing the system on CAD

2. Procuring components, construction and assembly of the prototype.

If the total goal is not reached, funding will be used for R&D of other aeroponic projects

The Impact

We started this project when we realised how important it is to live a healthy and sustainable lifestyle.  We chose microgreens  because of their many health benefits, at the seedling stage they are filled with 20 times more nutrient content. Micro-greens are also called Super-Food and
Functional Food by scientists.  It has been scientifically proven that eating Micro-greens can lower heart disease, better eyesight, lower cholesterol levels, improve digestion and strengthen the immune system.

Gardening has also proven to be beneficial for one’s mood. Studies have shown that horticulture can actually assist with mental health through stress relief.

Not only will BUSTAN have applications within businesses and homes, it can also be used as an educational tool. We will be able to provide a wide range of Educational Services, Tools,
Scientific Toys for kids. We want to promote Innovative Games for Experiments with Gardening , Growing and Hydroponic Cultivation Techniques.

We will be able to provide our services in a multi-dimensional and
comprehensive way. We will supply also Portable Hydroponic Units, Indoor Growing units, Air Filters, Seeds, Growing Media, Nutrient Solutions, Tools, Accessories and much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you share a passion about BUSTAN we would be very grateful if you could please share our page on any social media platform!

story:
Clean Energy Gummies

A delicious alternative to energy drinks

Hi I am Francisco the Founder of Active Nutrition. We are excited to introduce our first product called ACTIVE Gummies.

We have worked hard for months as a team to formulate a gummy with the absolute highest quality ingredients available.

We have a team of people with years of manufacturing experience. The ingredients are all vegan and contain natural sources or caffeine to give you an extra energy boost throughout your day.

We have our first samples but need your support to manufacture the first run of bottles.

Come join us to bring our vision to life!

What We Need to Succeed

We need a total of $40,000 for our full first production run:

  • All of the funds raised will go to manufacturing the gummies, labeling, and shipping to our distribution facilities. 
  • We have an Early Bird perk for those who support us first. This is a nice discount for our early backers.
  • The funds will all go towards the first production run no matter how much is raised.

The ACTIVE Gummies Impact

Your contribution is very important. You can help thousands of people break free from the unhealthy options available for the daily struggle to stay alert:

  • With your help we can bring a new product to life that will help hundreds of thousands of people around the world.
  • People are tired of energy drinks that make you feel jittery and full.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We would love for  get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • You can use social media and the Indiegogo sharing tools!

Spread the Word on Social Media

Share ACTIVE Gummies with all of your friends on Social Media:

  • We would love for you to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/activegummies

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/activegummies

Twitter: https://twitter.com/activegummies

story:
Waking up at 7 in the morning, being at your desk by 9 and clocking out around 5. With such a daily structure, life can feel stable. Having a steady paycheck and not having the success of the company you work for relying solely on you can be a comfortable routine. However; comfort, ease and predictability aren't what drive me. I feel unchallenged and dissatisfied with my life. There has to be more for me.

Just like me, there are many people who didn't feel like they fit in at a full-time job, working for someone else. Rather than giving in or giving up, they chose to go the exhilarating (and often unpredictable) route of becoming an entrepreneur instead.

I would rather be independent, looking after myself instead of being observed by higher-ups. I can build something from scratch. I'll feel a sense of satisfaction when I accomplish something. If I don't meet my quarterly earnings goal - it falls on me. Working at a company, on the other hand, is a group effort. And I feel like just another clog in the machine.

I don't fit into one job description. I am multi-talented and don't want to be pigeonholed as an accountant or data entry clerk. I believe I know how a business should be ran (I mean after all, I studied accounting and business as a major) and this motivates me to get directly involved. Instead of hitting my head against a wall when my boss makes a mistake, I can take charge and do it my own way.

I know that opening a business isn't easy, but I am truly passionate about it and there's no time like the present. I'm hungry to start a business and lead it to success. I'll stop at nothing to make this dream a reality.

Did you know that Americans alone consume about 400 million cups of coffee every single day? Demand for specialty coffee and espresso-based drinks continues to solidify. And today, more than ever it seems that many of our communities are hurting. Many of our neighbors are struggling.

A well located coffee shop that is welcoming and that offers a safe place to meet can make all the difference. There is something very powerful about creating a space that is meaningful to others too. A successful coffee shop can change a neighborhood. A coffee shop business that transforms a community is incredibly valuable . Coffee is all about community. I'd be socializing with neighbors and those just passing through. Overtime, I'll get to meet many wonderful people that I would never have gotten to meet otherwise. Some will become my regulars, others will drop by to say hello and give me updates on their life. Coffee brings many people together and my business will be no different.

We all want to feel connected. And the best part is - I'll be getting paid to connect and socialize with my neighbors. Today, more than ever, we need to feel connected to others. While many people love to shop online, get their news online and work alone, they still want to feel a sense of community. Perhaps my coffee will draw people closer together.

I love coffee! I know that coffee is a wonderful, magical, mystical and enchanting product. And it is super easy to fall in love with it and be passionate about it. I want to share my love of coffee with you! I want to bring great coffee to people who don't have access to great coffee. What can be better then that?

Did I mention that my business will have a tremendous impact on the lives of others? It can boost economic and social activity. I'll hire staff and/or baristas. I'll contribute to my local tax base and generally uplift the community. And to top it off, I'll be providing an excellent service and delivering a great product to my customers that they are going to love.

story:
MIZE Premium Italian White Marble 

 

We created a modern shape, inspired by nature which maintains a profound respect for both the environment and our artisans.

 

Each Mize product is a unique and handmade piece of art. Made in Italy with top quality Carrara white marble.

 

 

Our mission is to bring you a piece of italian history, directly into your glass.

 

 

Growing up in Florence and Pietrasanta, our team possesses a natural passion for the arts and sensibility for high quality Italian materials. Thus, we are driven by the love of our heritage and desire to share it with the world.

 

THE IMPACT:

 

Nowadays, almost everything we buy is mass produced by machines. Everything is all the same, lacking individuality and uniqueness.

 

Mize stones, however, aim to preserve Italian craftsmanship by keeping alive the art of marble sculpting. Our artisans are some of the few still using traditional techniques and working with marble manually.

 

                


​Each of our stones is touched by our artisans, giving them not only a special shape but also transmitting to each the soul of italian craftsmanship itself.

 

Touch and feel what makes a handmade artcraft different

 

OUR PRODUCTS:

 

    kits -whisky glass - amaro glass - cubic stone - natural stone - single stone - coasters

  • Glasses: two shapes of glass; the smaller and round Amaro and the bigger squared Whiskey.
  • Cubic Stones: handcrafted squared drinking stone. 100% genuine italian white marble.
  • Natural Stones: natural inspired shape. Cleaned and refined manually in Italy.
  • Single Stone: A bigger Natural Stone. Selected, recolted, cleaned and refined manually.
  • Coasters: Handmade Italian white marble coaster.
  • Bottle stand: every Stone is manually recolted and selected for its colour shape and grain, cutted and manually sculpted and refined. Every piece is different and unique!

 

 

THE MARBLE:

 

Its beautiful colour and pattern soothes one’s sight and mind.

To the touch our organic marble feels cold and smooth.

 

 

Throughout history italian marble has always been considered the pinnacle of luxury and elegance. Many civilizations in Italy fought to have access to this precious resource and even today marble is still a sought after luxury item.

 

 

Thanks to the popularity of marble, many places like places like Carrara, Forte dei Marmi, and Pietrasanta flourished and continue to thrive.

 

It is no surprise MIZE is based in Pietrasanta, a beautiful town filled with art galleries and surrounded by the beautiful mountains that are home to the stunning white Carrara marble we use for our products.

 

ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY:

 

We choose our marble from the best quality sites, looking for pure white colour and the perfect texture.

 

Moreover, we only use already extracted marble unsuited for construction because of its size.  

MIZE gives these pieces of marble a new life which helps preserve our mountains.

Mize is 100% italian white marble

Everything in the package is recyclable.

Our marble is 100% recycled or recuperated.

We don’t use chemicals.

Mize is made in Italy, from traditional business

Our stones and packaging are handmade.

Buying MIZE contributes to the conservation of italian marble craftsmanship.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

 

Supporting MIZE means investing in the heritage of our region and the skill of our artisans. As well as promoting a new philosophy that is centered about human value and environmental sustainability.

 

 

Your contribution will help us secure:

  • the best vendors to supply our glass and packaging
  • set up our e-commerce site and ship worldwide

 

In exchange for your support you will get:

  • your choice of MIZE product, handmade in Italy with certified italian marble
  • the gratitude of our entire team and the pride of helping an ancient art to survive automatization and plastic era.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP


If you want to help us you can share our Indiegogo page, follow us on instagram, like on facebook and share our posts!

Donate 5 $ we'll recolt a big piece of plastic from the beautiful rivers in the mountains and  engrave your name in the thank you stone!

share with your friends!  #mize #amizeng #marbleous

story:
Regenerate Yourself and The Environment With Biodynamic Coffee

I am Mike Liberatore, a proud father, former food activist and CrossFit gym owner.  I have a passion for living vibrantly and hope to enjoy the beauty of our natural planet with my family as I grow old. I am tired of shopping and constantly asking "Is this food healthy?" "How is this affecting the environment?" "Am I hurting our ecosystem?" 

So, I decided to invest into Biodynamic agriculture to procure food that positively impacts our lives and planet.  1% of all our proceeds will benefit the Biodynamic Association to empower new Biodynamic farmers.

Mike, Liz and Luca Liberatore

I believe most consumers truly want to help impact the environment, but we need convenient and transparent solutions to drive positive agricultural change. Being a father and entrepreneur, by the time I go shopping, I have little time and energy to read labels and research products on my phone.  Biodynamic certification is the most thorough and transparent certification that provides me with the trust I need to feel confident in my food.  

Our first offering is micro roasted Biodynamic coffee from La Chacra D'Dago in Peru delivered in a 100% compostable bag.  La Chacra is a single origin, shade grown and washed Arabica bean.  We just received 600 kilos of Biodynamic beans stored in Providence, Rhode Island, and they are ready to be micro roasted in 20 pound batches. 

Last Spring, I visited the Biodynamic food forest of La Chacra D'Dago, located 1,550 meters above sea level in the mountains of Peru, just outside the Amazon rainforest.  I personally worked with Dagoberto Marín and his family on their coffee farm to learn about their Biodynamic process.  Dagoberto and his sons Eduardo and César manage the farm operation with the help of about 10 families who live on-site and send their children to school in nearby Villa Rica.

Mike at La Chacra D'Dago in Villa Rica, Peru last February 2019
 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $12,000 in capital through pre-sales in order to increase our economies of scale.  We will use the capital to source larger quantities and more varieties of Biodynamic coffee.  Your support will help us reduce cost while maintaining our commitment to quality and expand our support for regenerative agriculture.

  • Conscious Consumers may enjoy Biodynamic coffee conveniently delivered within two (2) to seven (7) days of roasting based on shipping from Providence, RI.
  • Impact Investors can join us on our Sourcing and Yoga Tours to Mexico, Brazil and Peru or take advantage of heavily discounted coffee subscriptions for one year to ten years!
  • Non-coffee Drinkers can support our regenerative mission with t-shirts, gift certificates and special packages for your friends.
     

We are offering Medium and Medium-Dark roasts to accentuate the optimal flavor profiles of the La Chacra bean thanks to our roasting partner:  Borealis Roasting.  The Medium Roast offers a medium body with notes of dark chocolate, caramel and citrus peel.  The Medium Dark Roast presents a full body with notes of chocolate, nuts, and molasses.  La Chacra can be brewed well with any method.  Our friends and family have described La Chacra as "smooth" or "low-acid" and often drink it black when they normally would use milk or sugar.

100% Compostable Bag & Label. Custom designed bag will be developed with your support.

How Does Biodynamic Impact The Ecosystem?

Biodynamic is a form of agriculture that goes beyond organic, providing a highly beneficial impact to our ecosystem.  Biodynamics mimic the natural environment, requiring a whole system utilizing organic-only inputs and a biodiverse environment.  The result is a rich habitat for plants and wildlife to flourish - including coffee.  Biodynamic certification is conducted and enforced by Demeter International, a private non-profit entity. 

Drone shot of La Chacra D'Dago Farm.  Notice the coffee plants at the base of the forest.

    Why coffee? Conventional and monocultural coffee production are incredibly detrimental to the environment due to deforestation as well as the release of toxic chemicals into the air, water and soil. Biodynamic coffee production regenerates the environment by developing biodiverse, nutrient rich and organic habitats.

    Our History:  Mike is a former co-owner of CrossFit Providence from 2008-2017 and worked on a food legislation campaign in Rhode Island with his wife Elizabeth Guardia.  Together, they have conducted yoga retreats to Central America, Europe and Asia, introducing North Americans to new cultures and a healthy lifestyle.  Mike grew up in the coffee industry, working in his father's coffee factory in Newington, CT in the 1980s.  With their alignment of fitness, food and coffee, Mike & Liz seek to expand Biodynamic agriculture to benefit the environment.

    Your Opportunity:  Together, we can vote every morning for positive environmental impact by enjoying a cup of our La Chacra Biodynamic Coffee.  Come join our family in living vibrantly and regenerating our beautiful natural world!

    100% Organic Cotton T-Shirts Available

    Liberation Food Co:  Bird in Flight

    Liberation Food Co:  Bird in Flight
     

    Liberation Food Co:  Logo

    Risks & Challenges

    We have already received our Biodynamic green coffee from Peru and it is waiting to be micro roasted for your order! Our roasting and packaging operation are queued up and ready to go. Demeter certification is underway and inspection is scheduled for later this month (September).  We expect to receive Biodynamic certification in October.

    With the help of this Indiegogo campaign, we aim to diversify our coffee offering by sourcing two (2) more coffee varieties in Latin America.  As we are committed to enhancing the environment, we will only import food that can not be grown locally and we will always work to minimize and offset our carbon footprint.  Shipping is our largest carbon producer.  We are continually working to minimize shipping impact as well as exploring shipping alternatives like sail freight.

    Liz and Mike have successfully run wellness retreats all over the world including:  India, Italy, Iceland, Portugal, Costa Rica and Panama.  With our family and friends on the ground in Peru, we are fully prepared to host a small group of adventurers!

    Coffee and/or T-Shirt delivery to your door could take up to four (4) weeks from the reception of your pledge due to delays in closing this campaign or receiving our Biodynamic certification from Demeter.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Social media is a powerful tool for you to help!  Share our Indiegogo campaign drive with your friends and you will have a direct contribution to success.  Please always consider what you are consuming and try to direct your purchases towards sustainability and regeneration.

    Join our Yoga and Sourcing Tour in Peru 

    June 13th to 23rd

    Join Mike and Liz this coming June on a Liberation Food Co. Sourcing trip to Peru! The trip will start off with a flight into Lima where we will spend two nights in Barranco, checking out the significant art district, enjoying world famous Peruvian cuisines, visiting with Liz’s great aunt for a traditional Peruvian meal and touring Mercado de las Brujas.

    After three days in Lima we will get on a bus and head to Villa Rica, the home of La Chacra D’Dago. Cesar and his father Dagoberto are the beautiful people behind our delicious coffee. They are so excited that we are bringing people to the farm! Be prepared for a wild bus ride through the Andes (this experience alone will make your trip memorable).

    Once we get to the farm, we will be settled there for 3 nights. Each day will start with fitness and yoga, followed by homemade Biodynamic breakfast, lunch and dinner. Between meals we will explore, hike, swim and learn all about the farm and this beautiful region of Peru.

    After 4 days at the farm we will head to Cusco by way of Huancayo. After a 5.5 hour drive through the Andes and a short flight over some tall mountains, we will land in the Sacred town of Cusco. We will spend a night in Cusco for a day of exploring and shopping and then by train we head to Aguas Calientes, at the base of Machu Picchu. We will have a day to soak in the thermal baths and relax before waking up very early the next day to visit one of the wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

    After 4 days in Aguas Calientes we will fly back to Lima and depart for home.

    *Included in this trip are: daily breakfast, yoga or fitness, meditation, listed excursions and all ground transportation and domestic airfare.

    *You are responsible for: Your flight to and from Lima, trip insurance and additional meals.

    Price:  $3,500 double room shared | $4,000 single room not shared  
    Deposit:  $900 (non-refundable)
    Remainder of price must be paid prior to February 1, 2020

    12 Month+ Subscribers Receive

    an Airscape Container

    Airscape Ceramic Storage Containers are free with 12+ month subscriptions

     

    VISIT OUR WEBSITE


    Media Credits:

    Drone Footage:  Eduardo Arce Marín from La Chacra D'Dago
    Interview:  Rupert Whiteley (https://rupertwhiteley.com/)
    B-Role and Editing:  Dave Counts (https://countswebdesign.com)
    B-Role Actors:  Our friends and Family!
    Machu Picchu and Lima Photos by Willian Justen de Vasconcellos on Unsplash
    San Miguel De Allende Photo by Daniels Joffe on Unsplash

story:
“More people have booked recreational space flights than there have been astronauts in space over the past 57 years. And just like we saw in commercial aviation history, space travellers are going to want to enjoy certain creature comforts, like good beer, while enjoying their suborbital experience.” J. Mitchell.

 

 

Hi! We’re 4 Pines Brewing Company (beer lovers) and Saber Astronautics (space gurus) from Manly, Australia on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. We’ve joined forces and we’re on a mission of galactic proportions. We are destined to go where humanity never has before and create the world’s first beer for space!

 

Every worthwhile space voyage needs a mission name, and ours is ‘Vostok’. Back in 1961, humanity’s first ever manned space flight was aboard the vessel ‘Vostok’. Yuri Gagarin returned safely home after 90 minutes of flight and became a global legend.

Whilst looking down on Earth, the only thing that was missing to toast the occasion was space beer.

So why Space Beer you ask? 

More recreational space flights have been booked than there have been astronauts in space in the last 57 years. With space tourism a burgeoning reality and hundreds of rejoicing, happy space fans booked on suborbital flights, we wanted to be well prepared. 

Imagine if you were one of these future tourists…

From the dawn of civilisation, humanity brewed beer and wherever we venture, beer follows. Fast forward to today and off the back of those hefty space travel ticket prices, you’d want to be drinking the good beer you drink at home – and if it’s tasting good down here, imagine how it’d be up there, with views of our big blue globe!

We initially set out to create a beer that could be drunk in space and with that achieved, the next step was to develop technology that would allow people to drink the stout, or any liquid for that matter, from a bottle like their fellow land-dwellers.

 

 

There were two major challenges we needed to solve to be successful:

Alcohol absorption by the human body is different. The tongue swells, the senses dull – altering the way food and drink tastes and wet burps (belching both liquid & gas) are a real thing - so we had to re-imagine beer from scratch.


The biggest challenge is liquid’s inability to pour in zero gravity. This means that to drink beer from a bottle the same way that you do on Earth, a special space beer bottle needed to be created. "It’s basically like making a fuel tank for your beer".​

 

 

We have been working on Vostok Space Beer for the past six years and we’ve come a long way. But now we want you to join the journey. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and manufacturing so we can make Vostok Space Beer available to. With your backing, you can play a small role in sending the comforts from home with those who venture beyond our planet. You can know the impact you’ll have on not just us, the beer and space community, but beyond even our own planet, and the future of space travel and research.

For the love of beer, and on to space!

  • To do and own something that no human on the planet has ever done before
  • Be the first to get your hands on the world’s first beer for space.
  • You’ve got a ticket to ride and you think it’d be awesome to drink beer on your space flight.
  • You love beer.
  • You love space.
  • You want to support fun innovations like this so we can do more fun stuff that just makes the whole world a bit more fun.

 

JUNE 2010. Vostok is Born!

JULY 2010. First batch of 500 cases of Stout are bottled. Four small 5L kegs are prepped for testing and experimentation.

SEPTEMBER 2010: Astronauts4Hire (A4H) selected from a short-list of over 50 applicants to be the official Vostok in-flight beer taster and Zero gravity researcher.

NOVEMBER 2010: To understand the physical and chemical responses of beer in zero gravity we dropped the beer off a 23m drop tower (to simulate the effect of zero gravity).

DECEMBER 2010: A tester from A4H undergoes measurements of his body’s normal terrestrial responses to drinking.

FEBRUARY 2011: Microgravity test complete and history is made! This hits two milestones. It was humanity’s first look at alcohol absorption effects in zero gravity. It is also the first beer in aviation history to be formally tested on a commercial microgravity flight.

MAY 2011: Distribution of the stout (baseline Earth version) goes National in Australia.

SEPTEMBER 2011: Set the R&D plan for the Space Beer Bottle. With a literature review, concept to full spec design, engineering, test phases; it’s like making a fuel tank for your beer.

MAY 2012:  GOLD MEDAL and trophy winner at the Australian International Beer Awards. This beer is now officially the #1 Stout amongst a competitive set of beers from all over the world

JUNE 2012: Saber Astronautics completed the first phase on the Space Beer Bottle. The design passes simulation analysis to include vibration, fluid flows and surface tension.

SEPTEMBER 2012: Fresh off the press is the 3D printed Space Beer prototype. We took it to the 4 Pines filler machine to test the fittings.

DECEMBER 2012: We’ve narrowed down several concept CAD sketches for the Space Beer Bottle Insert.

NOVEMBER 2013: Saber Astronautics flies two prototypes with a highly successful ZERO-G test flight. One prototype 3D printed, one out of medical grade stainless steel.

FEBRUARY 2015: Industrial Design of the Space Beer Bottle begins, with the help of our pals at AUXILIARY and a design is selected. This then leads to concept refinement and down-selection to two bottle design options.

SEPTEMBER 2017: Scoured the planet for over a year on a journey to find manufacturers that were capable to build the world’s first beer for space.

JANUARY 2018: Industrial Design Engineering completed for two viable build configurations ready for high fidelity prototype testing in Zero Gravity

 

 

Off the back of those hefty space travel ticket prices, you’d want to be drinking the good beer you drink at home – and if it’s tasting good down here, imagine how it’d be up there, with views of our big blue globe.

It’s been a labour of love, a fine art – making a beer that can be enjoyed on earth as it is in the heavens. Human biology changes in zero gravity conditions. The tongue swells, the senses dull – altering the way food and drink tastes.

So what does the beer taste like? Well…out of this world! But seriously the baseline recipe is a dry Irish style Stout made with a seven-strong malt line-up. We picked a high flavoured beer as the baseline recipe to ensure that space travellers could enjoy the full flavour of the smoky Irish style Stout, no matter how long the flight duration. The aroma profile is of coffee, chocolate and caramel malts. These are matched on the palette with a full bodies, smooth finish and a balancing bitterness.

5.1% Alc/Vol | 40 IBU

"A dry Irish style stout, presenting almost black & bearing a generous tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and caramel are matched with a full bodied mouthfeel, a smooth finish and rounding bitterness"

 

 

 

We're pretty stoked with our recipe for space, and it seems others' are too! We're humbled to have received many Beer Industry Awards:

  • 2012| GOLD CHAMPION | Australian International Beer Awards (AIBA)
  • 2013 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
  • 2014 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
  • 2015 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
  • 2015 | SILVER | Craft Beer Industry Awards (CBIA)

 

 

Engineered and designed especially for drinking beer in space, the Vostok Space Beer bottle uses modified technology based on fuel tanks to defy the challenges of drinking in zero gravity​.

 

 

Once we validated the beer recipe, the next step was to develop technology that would allow people to drink the stout, or any liquid for that matter, from a bottle like their fellow land-dwellers. Because those hard-working astronautics shouldn’t have to drink their award winning beer from a ‘squeeze’ bag. They deserve a real bottle to let them kick back and feel at home.

And here is the challenge - liquid needs gravity to pour, so how do you get the beer out of the bottle, with it feeling like a normal bottle?  Squeegies, plungers, and springs only take away from that home feeling we want the astronauts to have.  And they also add pressure to the beer in ways we don’t want.

So to answer this question, the space ninjas, our partners at Saber Astronautics decided to use the forces available to us.  And that means surface tension, that mysterious elf who causes beer to cling to glasses on Earth, is a force to recon with in space.  Saber made an insert that can wick the beer from the bottom of the bottle to the neck, turning any normal bottle into a fuel tank for your beer.

*Please note that current images and footage here of Vostok Space Beer are prototypes and as such, the end product may slightly differ.

 

 

 

After successfully creating a flavourful, award-winning beer for space, we’re now in the final stages of testing and developing the technology that will allow space travellers to drink the beer in the same way as we do on Earth. We’re on a mission to make the World’s First Beer for Space become a reality!

8 years of Brewers and Space Engineers time to develop, test and approve:

  • Space Beer recipe
  • Wicking insert for bottle
  • Bottle design

We currently have a working prototype and we're now focused on:

  • Finalising the engineering schematics for final bottle production
  • Designing packaging
  • Developing the beer filling process
  • Tooling
  • Materials procurement
  • Bottle production

  • Filling the bottle with beer!
  • Sending some lucky punters into space, to drink the first space beer!

We are doing something that has never been done before: beer in space. While there may be manufacturing and production delays outside of our control, we promise timely and transparent communication throughout the process.

The joint venture between 4 Pines & Saber Astronautics started over a few innocent beers at the 4 Pines Brewpub in Manly.

We would talk about space, we would talk about beer, we would talk about other things as well. Luckily the head of Saber is a PhD and has about 15 degrees otherwise we may have never have got to this point. One day he asks the 4 Pines founder “so how would you like to put your beer into space?” Pure Genius.

In addition to our core Space Beer team, we've assembled an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to bring Space Beer to infinity and beyond!

 

      Jaron Mitchell: Chief of Beer Chiefs at 4 Pines Brewing Co.

     Dr. Jason Held: Chief Executive Officer at Saber Astronautics

 

 

Pines was born over a decade ago from a casual conversation between a father and son, post surf, who simply wanted an exceptional beer and options were limited. Built on throwing convention out the window, using alternative methods to measure success and having fun while we did it, this innocent conversation that evolved into a brewpub became the foundation of a lifelong journey with family, friends and the community to restore the fun in people’s lives and forever challenge what the world imagines business should be. Our quest to send beer into space is just one example of this.

The specially brewed 4 Pines Dry Irish Stout needed to balance both a rich flavour with low levels of carbonation to avoid a ‘wet burp’ in space. Burping both gas and liquid isn’t ideal for space tourists, so a rigorous amount of zero gravity testing was conducted to achieve the perfect beer. The beer has been commercially available in Australia since 2011 as 4 Pines Dry Irish Stout and won a gold medal at the 2012 Australian International Beer Awards.

*4 Pines Brewing Co. is backed by ZX Ventures, the disruptive growth organisation of Ab InBev.

4 Pines Brewing Co. Australian Liquor Licence No: 8585

Saber Astronautics is a space engineering company conducting cutting edge R&D in the fields of operations and logistics. We design tools for emerging commercial space industry and apply them to everyday challenges on Earth. Our partners have engineered legacy projects such as the Hubble Space Telescope and International Space Station. We have senior operators from US Army and Air Force Space Command and two PhD graduates from a world class field robotics laboratory in Sydney.

 

 

"From the dawn of civilisation, people brewed beer and wherever people went, beer followed".

 

Since the start of our journey our research and development has featured in many publications.

story_txt:
“More people have booked recreational space flights than there have been astronauts in space over the past 57 years. And just like we saw in commercial aviation history, space travellers are going to want to enjoy certain creature comforts, like good beer, while enjoying their suborbital experience.” J. Mitchell.
 

 
Hi! We’re 4 Pines Brewing Company (beer lovers) and Saber Astronautics (space gurus) from Manly, Australia on Sydney’s Northern Beaches. We’ve joined forces and we’re on a mission of galactic proportions. We are destined to go where humanity never has before and create the world’s first beer for space!

 
Every worthwhile space voyage needs a mission name, and ours is ‘Vostok’. Back in 1961, humanity’s first ever manned space flight was aboard the vessel ‘Vostok’. Yuri Gagarin returned safely home after 90 minutes of flight and became a global legend.
Whilst looking down on Earth, the only thing that was missing to toast the occasion was space beer.
So why Space Beer you ask? 

More recreational space flights have been booked than there have been astronauts in space in the last 57 years. With space tourism a burgeoning reality and hundreds of rejoicing, happy space fans booked on suborbital flights, we wanted to be well prepared. 
Imagine if you were one of these future tourists…

From the dawn of civilisation, humanity brewed beer and wherever we venture, beer follows. Fast forward to today and off the back of those hefty space travel ticket prices, you’d want to be drinking the good beer you drink at home – and if it’s tasting good down here, imagine how it’d be up there, with views of our big blue globe!
We initially set out to create a beer that could be drunk in space and with that achieved, the next step was to develop technology that would allow people to drink the stout, or any liquid for that matter, from a bottle like their fellow land-dwellers.
 

 
There were two major challenges we needed to solve to be successful:

Alcohol absorption by the human body is different. The tongue swells, the senses dull – altering the way food and drink tastes and wet burps (belching both liquid & gas) are a real thing - so we had to re-imagine beer from scratch.
The biggest challenge is liquid’s inability to pour in zero gravity. This means that to drink beer from a bottle the same way that you do on Earth, a special space beer bottle needed to be created. "It’s basically like making a fuel tank for your beer".​
 

 

We have been working on Vostok Space Beer for the past six years and we’ve come a long way. But now we want you to join the journey. Your support will allow us to initiate tooling and manufacturing so we can make Vostok Space Beer available to. With your backing, you can play a small role in sending the comforts from home with those who venture beyond our planet. You can know the impact you’ll have on not just us, the beer and space community, but beyond even our own planet, and the future of space travel and research.
For the love of beer, and on to space!


To do and own something that no human on the planet has ever done before
Be the first to get your hands on the world’s first beer for space.
You’ve got a ticket to ride and you think it’d be awesome to drink beer on your space flight.
You love beer.
You love space.
You want to support fun innovations like this so we can do more fun stuff that just makes the whole world a bit more fun.

 



JUNE 2010. Vostok is Born!

JULY 2010. First batch of 500 cases of Stout are bottled. Four small 5L kegs are prepped for testing and experimentation.

SEPTEMBER 2010: Astronauts4Hire (A4H) selected from a short-list of over 50 applicants to be the official Vostok in-flight beer taster and Zero gravity researcher.

NOVEMBER 2010: To understand the physical and chemical responses of beer in zero gravity we dropped the beer off a 23m drop tower (to simulate the effect of zero gravity).

DECEMBER 2010: A tester from A4H undergoes measurements of his body’s normal terrestrial responses to drinking.

FEBRUARY 2011: Microgravity test complete and history is made! This hits two milestones. It was humanity’s first look at alcohol absorption effects in zero gravity. It is also the first beer in aviation history to be formally tested on a commercial microgravity flight.

MAY 2011: Distribution of the stout (baseline Earth version) goes National in Australia.

SEPTEMBER 2011: Set the R&D plan for the Space Beer Bottle. With a literature review, concept to full spec design, engineering, test phases; it’s like making a fuel tank for your beer.

MAY 2012:  GOLD MEDAL and trophy winner at the Australian International Beer Awards. This beer is now officially the #1 Stout amongst a competitive set of beers from all over the world


JUNE 2012: Saber Astronautics completed the first phase on the Space Beer Bottle. The design passes simulation analysis to include vibration, fluid flows and surface tension.

SEPTEMBER 2012: Fresh off the press is the 3D printed Space Beer prototype. We took it to the 4 Pines filler machine to test the fittings.

DECEMBER 2012: We’ve narrowed down several concept CAD sketches for the Space Beer Bottle Insert.

NOVEMBER 2013: Saber Astronautics flies two prototypes with a highly successful ZERO-G test flight. One prototype 3D printed, one out of medical grade stainless steel.

FEBRUARY 2015: Industrial Design of the Space Beer Bottle begins, with the help of our pals at AUXILIARY and a design is selected. This then leads to concept refinement and down-selection to two bottle design options.

SEPTEMBER 2017: Scoured the planet for over a year on a journey to find manufacturers that were capable to build the world’s first beer for space.

JANUARY 2018: Industrial Design Engineering completed for two viable build configurations ready for high fidelity prototype testing in Zero Gravity
 

 
Off the back of those hefty space travel ticket prices, you’d want to be drinking the good beer you drink at home – and if it’s tasting good down here, imagine how it’d be up there, with views of our big blue globe.

It’s been a labour of love, a fine art – making a beer that can be enjoyed on earth as it is in the heavens. Human biology changes in zero gravity conditions. The tongue swells, the senses dull – altering the way food and drink tastes.
So what does the beer taste like? Well…out of this world! But seriously the baseline recipe is a dry Irish style Stout made with a seven-strong malt line-up. We picked a high flavoured beer as the baseline recipe to ensure that space travellers could enjoy the full flavour of the smoky Irish style Stout, no matter how long the flight duration. The aroma profile is of coffee, chocolate and caramel malts. These are matched on the palette with a full bodies, smooth finish and a balancing bitterness.

5.1% Alc/Vol | 40 IBU
"A dry Irish style stout, presenting almost black & bearing a generous tan head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and caramel are matched with a full bodied mouthfeel, a smooth finish and rounding bitterness"
 

 

 
We're pretty stoked with our recipe for space, and it seems others' are too! We're humbled to have received many Beer Industry Awards:

2012| GOLD CHAMPION | Australian International Beer Awards (AIBA)
2013 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
2014 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
2015 | SILVER | Australian International Beer Awards 
2015 | SILVER | Craft Beer Industry Awards (CBIA)

 

 

Engineered and designed especially for drinking beer in space, the Vostok Space Beer bottle uses modified technology based on fuel tanks to defy the challenges of drinking in zero gravity​.

 
 
Once we validated the beer recipe, the next step was to develop technology that would allow people to drink the stout, or any liquid for that matter, from a bottle like their fellow land-dwellers. Because those hard-working astronautics shouldn’t have to drink their award winning beer from a ‘squeeze’ bag. They deserve a real bottle to let them kick back and feel at home.

And here is the challenge - liquid needs gravity to pour, so how do you get the beer out of the bottle, with it feeling like a normal bottle?  Squeegies, plungers, and springs only take away from that home feeling we want the astronauts to have.  And they also add pressure to the beer in ways we don’t want.
So to answer this question, the space ninjas, our partners at Saber Astronautics decided to use the forces available to us.  And that means surface tension, that mysterious elf who causes beer to cling to glasses on Earth, is a force to recon with in space.  Saber made an insert that can wick the beer from the bottom of the bottle to the neck, turning any normal bottle into a fuel tank for your beer.

We’re on a mission to make the World’s First Beer for Space become a reality!

For shipping of Perks with beer, the following applies:  

Beer will only be available to the following countries: Australia, UK and the US. 
For Australia and the UK there will be various pick-up options at no additional cost. With appropriate I.D there will also be mail options with additional cost.
For the US, there will only be pick-up options, there are yet to be determined, however our aim for US residents in major cities is that these pick-up locations will be within 150 miles and often far closer.

 

 
The joint venture between 4 Pines & Saber Astronautics started over a few innocent beers at the 4 Pines Brewpub in Manly.
We would talk about space, we would talk about beer, we would talk about other things as well. Luckily the head of Saber is a PhD and has about 15 degrees otherwise we may have never have got to this point. One day he asks the 4 Pines founder “so how would you like to put your beer into space?” Pure Genius.
In addition to our core Space Beer team, we've assembled an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to bring Space Beer to infinity and beyond!
 
      Jaron Mitchell: Chief of Beer Chiefs at 4 Pines Brewing Co.
     Dr. Jason Held: Chief Executive Officer at Saber Astronautics
 
 
Pines was born over a decade ago from a casual conversation between a father and son, post surf, who simply wanted an exceptional beer and options were limited. Built on throwing convention out the window, using alternative methods to measure success and having fun while we did it, this innocent conversation that evolved into a brewpub became the foundation of a lifelong journey with family, friends and the community to restore the fun in people’s lives and forever challenge what the world imagines business should be. Our quest to send beer into space is just one example of this.
The specially brewed 4 Pines Dry Irish Stout needed to balance both a rich flavour with low levels of carbonation to avoid a ‘wet burp’ in space. Burping both gas and liquid isn’t ideal for space tourists, so a rigorous amount of zero gravity testing was conducted to achieve the perfect beer. The beer has been commercially available in Australia since 2011 as 4 Pines Dry Irish Stout and won a gold medal at the 2012 Australian International Beer Awards.
*4 Pines Brewing Co. is backed by ZX Ventures, the disruptive growth organisation of Ab InBev.
4 Pines Brewing Co. Australian Liquor Licence No: 8585

Saber Astronautics is a space engineering company conducting cutting edge R&D in the fields of operations and logistics. We design tools for emerging commercial space industry and apply them to everyday challenges on Earth. Our partners have engineered legacy projects such as the Hubble Space Telescope and International Space Station. We have senior operators from US Army and Air Force Space Command and two PhD graduates from a world class field robotics laboratory in Sydney.
 

 

"From the dawn of civilisation, people brewed beer and wherever people went, beer followed".
 

Since the start of our journey our research and development has featured in many publications.See below or click here for more.

http://www.sbs.com.au/food/article/2016/06/14/boldly-go-where-no-beer-has-gone
http://www.businessinsider.com.au/space-beer-2011-5?r=US&IR=T
http://www.smh.com.au/technology/sci-tech/beam-me-up-shhhcotty--the-aussie-space-beer-with-zero-gravity-20101001-15zzh.html
http://www.news.com.au/technology/vostok-beer-is-a-sturdy-stout-you-can-swig-in-space/story-e6frfro0-1226013624363
http://www.geek.com/geek-cetera/vostok-4-pines-stout-space-beer-brewed-for-zero-gravity-1380379/
http://www.beerandbrewer.com/4-pines-brings-bottled-beer-in-space-one-step-closer/
http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2011/02/16/3140547.htm
http://www.space.com/11706-space-beer-microgravity.html
http://www.executivestyle.com.au/space-beer-brewed-for-zerogravity-thirst-1es94
https://foodmag.com.au/space-beer-one-giant-leap-for-mankind/

story:
Fight Against the Water Crisis 

    Ask and you shall receive. Stay hydrated and fight the water crisis in developing countries with Hydro Homies Water.

What We Need & What You Get

    50% of all donations and a portion of all sales will go to charities to fight against the water crisis in developing countries. The rest will go to launching Hydro Homie Water.

The Impact

    Every purchase will help people in developing countries get access to clean potable water.

Risks & Challenges

    Hydro Homies Water needs your help to get off the ground. With your help we can make this a viable, sustainable long term way to provide access to clear water those who need it most.  

Other Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word on Reddit, Discord and social media. Every bit helps those in need. You can message me personally on Reddit @ HydroHomieWaterMan.

story:
The First Modern Stein

The EPOCH with lid

The AEON mug 

 

 

 

HOW IT WORKS

The Very Best Glass

The heart of the Kramstein is the glass. Our 5mm Borosilicate is the very best glass you can get. The glass is suspended by ionomer bushings, within a 6061 T6 alloy frame, and fastened with stainless steel hardware.

 

A Strong Alloy Chassis

The alloy frame that holds our glass, is machined from 6061 T6 Aluminum. As machinists, we wanted a strong metal frame holding our thick glass. Anodized for a strong finish, and fastened together with stainless steel hardware, the result is eye-catching and will last a lifetime.  

 

When you find that special beer you've been wanting to try, you'll want it to be the very best experience possible. Imagine drinking from a weighty stein, that won't rotate in your grip, or get clammy and cold. The solid metal frame feels great to hold. The polished, rounded glass edge feels great against the lips. It makes drinking more enjoyable - and that's the whole point of drinking craft beer.  

WHO WE ARE

 

We're machinists and designers working and living in the San Jose Bay Area, and have been building products for others for over 20 years. We've even worked on a few successful Indiegogo products. Now we're making our steins, and hope you will join us. 

FAQ

 

1. Have your shipping prices changed?

Yes! We have teamed up with shipbob.com, and we are now able to ship our steins at lower prices than previously shown. We have notified those of you who backed us prior to our change, and will make certain that all of our backers get the improved shipping prices. 

2. What are the major risks to production and timely delivery?

The major risk in a delay in production, is how quickly we can receive the glass, if we were to receive orders for a very large number of steins. We have worked very hard to resolve all the major issues, and we believe that we can deliver as expected.

The second risk, would be if we surpassed the $17,500 mark, but do not go higher than $30k. This will mean we would need to use our staged-tooling, which would require more quality assurance, and take a bit longer to deliver parts. Manufacturing always comes with issues that require attention. We now have a very good working relationship with our vendors, and expect that we can deliver great product on time.  

3. Was this campaign previously run on Kickstarter?

Yes. We originally launched the Kramstein on Kickstarter in January 2017. We quickly reached $11,251.00, but could not move further at that time. 

4. What changes have you made? 

We have changed every single part of our design. We have reduced the part count, greatly improved the quality of the glass, and simplified the design. 

5. How can you afford to run the campaign for nearly half the cost of the first campaign?

A full run of production tooling will still cost us $30k. We have moved our injection-moulding to a staged-setup. For any parts produced between $17,500 and $30k, we will use a short-run tool that is far less expensive. When we surpass the $30k mark, we will be able to use the full production tooling once again. Either way, we will be able to deliver steins to you.

6. Will steins be available for sale outside of crowdfunding? 

When we succeed, and after every single backer has their stein and is happy with it - only then we will begin selling steins from our website. If the shipping costs deter you from backing us now, we hope you will look for us when we succeed, and larger distribution absorbs those costs. 

 

Even if beer isn't your thing, chances are you know a few people who do enjoy beer, and could use a new mug or stein. Sharing our campaign is just as important to us as a pledge! We appreciate your support.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I will do this in the form of a review website, complete with photos, videos, and written words about each Big N' Toasted experience.

The website will be accessible to all, but a more detailed e-mail newsletter will also go out to all investors in the project. Depending on the success of this campaign, this newsletter may contain special behind-the-scenes footage, insider Dunkin' tips, celebrity interviews and more personalized content.

I've calculated exactly how much money it will take for me to complete this project:

Suggested retail price for 1 Big N' Toasted: $3.29

New York City Sales Tax: 8.875%

Number of Dunkin' Donuts in the city of New York: 568

Estimated transportation fare per trip: $5.50

Indiegogo's percentage of all funds raised: 5%

((($3.29 x 1.08875) x 568)) + ($5.50 x 568)) x 1.05 = $5,416.50

It's a pretty ambitious goal, but this is a task that requires boldness. I have always loved Dunkin' Donuts and think I am fit for the job.

Thank you in advance to everyone who helps bring this project to life.

story:
The New Way To Wine

Pinch yourself it's not a dream! Finally, a smaller portion size of chic, sexy wines from all over the world.  Don't want to open the entire bottle?  No problem!  Enjoy one great glass of wine.  You deserve it! 

Sign up today and take advantage of our Lifetime FREE shipping promotion.  *California State Residents ONLY 

 

87% Larger Than Any Other Wine Tube

 

Looking For The Best Christmas Gift Idea Ever?  

Looking for a corporate gift idea?  Maybe a Secret Santa box?  We have a perfect gift for everyone.  Scroll over to see all our amazing gifts.  Gift ideas starting at as low as $10.  

 

 

You Deserve A Great Glass Of Wine

Do you enjoy coming home after a long day, relaxing, turning on your favorite Netflix series and having a glass of wine?  Of course!  Who doesn't?  With our membership, you no longer have to worry about committing to an entire bottle!  

Introducing, the world's first 187ml wine of the month club.   

 

Who Is This Wine Club For? 

This wine club is perfect if you:

  1. Want to have a glass of wine without the commitment of opening an entire bottle.
  2. Want to experience amazing wines from all over the world from the comfort of your own home.
  3. Want to become a better wine drinker and expand your palate.
  4. Want to spice up your date night. There is enough wine in each tube for two!

 

 

Is The Wine Any Good? 

OMG, this is the most exciting part! We can’t wait for you to try our wines.  Each wine is so good! 

As you can see, we don’t do boring. We want every wine to take your palate on an adventure. We have a naturally colored blue Chardonnay from Spain. Yes, it's naturally blue! We have exotic grape varietals from Turkey's oldest winery.  We even have a wine made by the same winemaker that makes the wine for the Pope.

All our wines are exclusive to members only and aren't sold anywhere else in the USA. 

 

No Risk.  Cancel Or Pause Your Membership Any time!

We believe in building a family of wine lovers.  If at any time you want to cancel or pause your membership, we will refund your money no questions asked.  We are a small start-up that believes in offering outstanding customer service.   But, we're not worried, we know you will love us.  

Note- Our wine membership can only ship within the state of California.   We recommend shipping to a business location, however, we do ship to residential.  

 

If I Like The Wine Can I Order It By The Bottle?

Wouldn’t make much sense if you couldn’t! There is a time and place for wine by the glass, but also for full-size bottles (everyone knows what “come over and watch a movie” means!) You will have exclusive membership access links to purchase full bottles. You can mix and match, buy all the same one, whatever! We will even give members HUGE discounts. 

 

 

 

 

Sign Up Today
